title: Higher Education Sector visa (subclass 573)
summary: This page provides information for people who currently hold or applied before 30 June 2016 for the Higher Education Sector visa (subclass 573), which is now closed to new applicants. It explains visa validity, rights, obligations, work conditions, family member conditions, and rules for changing education providers or welfare arrangements for minors.

who_this_information_is_for: People who already hold a Higher Education Sector visa (subclass 573)
People who applied for the visa on or before 30 June 2016 and are awaiting a decision

conditions: Must accompany the holder after the course has commenced

work_rights_family_members.general_limit: 40 hours per fortnight once visa holder has commenced study
work_rights_family_members.postgraduate_exception: Unlimited hours if the visa holder is studying a Masters degree and has commenced the course

family_study_rights.longer_study_requirement: must apply for own student visa (application can be made in Australia)

holder_obligations: Apply for a Student Visa (subclass 500) if changing to a course in a different education sector

risk_of_cancellation_conditions: Seeking to transfer to a non-eligible education provider (before 1 July 2016)
Transfer requested within first 12 months of visa grant
Holder is not from a country that was Assessment Level 1 before 1 July 2016

obligations.checking_conditions: Check via VEVO or visa grant letter

requirements: Must meet ESOS National Code requirements
changing_education_provider.six_month_rule: If less than six months of the principal course completed, permission from current provider is usually required

appeal_process.step_2: If unsatisfied, appeal to State or Territory Ombudsman or Overseas Student Ombudsman

students_under_18.travel_restriction: Cannot travel to Australia until welfare arrangements commence
students_under_18.welfare_start_date: date nominated on Confirmation of Appropriate Accommodation/Welfare Arrangements (CAAW) letter
students_under_18.guardian_leaving_australia_requirement: alternative welfare arrangements must be approved before guardian leaves, otherwise visa may be cancelled

no_further_stay_condition.restriction: Cannot apply to stay beyond the specified date except in certain circumstances

must: remain a member of the holder's family
work no more than 40 hours per fortnight (unless exception applies)
attend school if of school age
family_member_obligations.exception: Family members of Masters students can work unlimited hours once the student starts their main course
family_member_obligations.consequence_of_breach: visa may be cancelled and departure from Australia may be required

tools_and_resources.vevo: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) allows checking of visa details and conditions
